intro: Geranium laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth geranium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of five-petaled flowers, usually in shades of pink, red, or white, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Geranium laevigatum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
